formattedAddress: 125 Chambers St, New York, NY 10007, USA
adrFormatAddress: 125 Chambers St, New York, NY 10007, USA

editorialSummary.text: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.

originalText.text:
Disgusted , the store manager drew mattiace is racist against black people , I ordered the same order 10/4 the largest size matcha and a cake pop and tipped 2 $ my total was 13.64 , today 10/5 I encountered the store manager who skipped me in line made everyone else that was white drinks , then gave me the wrong size drink . He then went ahead to tell me he has to charge me more for a bigger size cup and told me to stop talking cause he is the store manager and he can report me to be banned from the store ,
To abuse your power and treat consumers that are black like garbage is definitely insane . Whoever owns this chain needs to reevaluate their employees that they are putting in charge
The staff was very kind to me especially the cashier that‚Äôs why I always tip . But the store manager on 10/5/2023 at 11AM is disrespectful and I will not be supporting this establishment.

Not to mention him trying to make me look at more for an order I just made the day before , I know the pricing because o drink Starbucks every day !!!!! To over charge me for a bigger drink is crazyyyy

originalText.text: I went in to get a hot coffee and a bagel. The fact that i waited over an hour for my coffee is ridiculous and it felt like they forgot to make it. And on top of that, the lady didn't make thr coffe how i wanted which was rush by the way. They gotta do better.

originalText.text: i came in today and they let this homeless man inside he was rolling something up (possibly weed cause that‚Äôs what it smelt like) on the table. AND THERE WAS CHILDREN AROUND. Then he went to a corner and started to laugh i see this and im trying to hurry up and get my stuff but i was too late and he came to where i was and started getting in my face and laughing and saying something but i couldn‚Äôt understand. and no one was helping me. they just looked at this guy harassing me while i was scared. normally this place is good service is great up in tired of them allowing homeless people inside.

originalText.text: Honestly this is my new to go to Starbucks spot, the person taking my order was super friendly and asked for the correct spelling to my name which usually I wasn‚Äôt used to since most spots I go to would just right whatever, honestly a nice touch to this experience, I got my drink super quick too and the barista also asked for correct pronunciation to my name which again just gave a friendly atmosphere, I felt like I was actually being taken care so well
